timeline.message:
really exclude javax.servlet *
remove non needed enforcer rule in websocket poms
force search transitive

Signed-off-by: olivier lamy <oliver.lamy@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: I don't understand: the name of this enforcement is ban-javax-servlet-api, but pretty much every permutation of javax.servlet.* is excluded?
timeline.author: janbartel

replies.bodyText:
That is a maven coordinate ban, not a java package ban.
Notice the :?
The format of that line is groupId[:artifactId][:version][:type][:scope][:classifier]
So this usage is just banning the maven groupId of javax.servlet with any artifact/version/type etc ...
replies.author: joakime

replies.bodyText: Ah, I see the confusion: I thought the <exclude> was enumerating groupId.artifactIds to exclude from the ban, whereas you're saying they are enumerating things to include!
replies.author: janbartel

replies.bodyText: Per the rule: the <exclude> list is what is banned, the <include> list are exceptions to what is banned.
replies.author: joakime
